Lack enough support: The claim that the video was "banned" by Facebook lacks evidence and is contradicted by the fact that the video is still live and available on multiple platforms.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is a campaign ad from President Trump, but there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video has not been banned by Facebook, as it is still available on the platform.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential consequences of the video being banned by Facebook, as it implies that the ban has occurred without providing evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why the video was not found in the Facebook Ad Library, such as it not being an official campaign ad.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting the video as a campaign ad when there is no evidence to support this characterization.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the video being "banned" by Facebook, as it implies censorship or suppression without evidence.
